args.natural_language_statement: Suppose f' (x) and g' (x) exist, g'(x) â‰  0, and f(x) = g(x) = 0. Prove that lim_{t â†’ x} f(t)/g(t) = f'(x)/g'(x). Translate to Lean4, import Mathlib at the top, and end the Lean statement with := by sorry. Use HasDerivAt for existence of derivatives and express the limit as a Tendsto from nhds within the punctured neighborhood of x to nhds (f' / g').

args.content:
import Mathlib

variable {ð•œ : Type*} [NontriviallyNormedField ð•œ]

theorem Rudin_exercise_5_7 {f g : ð•œ â†’ ð•œ} {f' g' x : ð•œ}
  (hf : HasDerivAt f f' x) (hg : HasDerivAt g g' x)
  (hg_ne : g' â‰  0) (f_x : f x = 0) (g_x : g x = 0) :
  Filter.Tendsto (fun t => f t / g t) (nhdsWithin x {t | t â‰  x}) (nhds (f' / g')) := by sorry
